subject: Re: Adding NotImplmented interface to JUnit
msgSnippet: Thanks for the info. -Fazle ... ignores tests ... reports ... find ... not be
messageBody:
Thanks for the info.
-Fazle

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> Russell Gold wrote:
>
> > On Sat, 25 Sep 2004 12:53:44 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger
> > <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> > > As an alternative, use the JUnit-addons test runner, which
ignores tests
> > > whose names end in _ignored.
> >
> > As opposed to simply prepending a character or string to the test
> > name, which would hide it from JUnit?
>
> I suppose it depends on intent. The JUnit-addons test runner
reports
> "ignored" tests without actually executing them. Some people might
find
> that valuable in general, although I suppose in this case, it may
not be
> all that useful.
>
> Thanks for reminding me of a simpler solution.
>
> Take care.
>
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Predictable, repeatable, quality delivery
